str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to arrange in an orderly manner, i.e. Assign or dispose.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lodging, hospitality. From xenos; hospitality, i.e. a place of entertainment.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and tithemi; to expose; figuratively, to declare.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Early in the morning, at dawn. Adverb from pro; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Evening. Feminine of an adjective hesperos; the eve.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
